properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 12 at 2:40PM MST until January 13 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Glasgow MT
properties.description:
...ACCUMULATING SNOW EXPECTED TONIGHT AND MONDAY...

.Light snow will begin to spread across the advisory area this
evening and become steadier late tonight and Monday. Accumulating
snow will lead to snow covered roads before tapering off Monday
afternoon and evening. In addition, dangerously cold wind chills
are expected to develop this evening and linger at times through
Monday.

* WHAT...Snow and cold wind chills expected. Total snow
accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Wind chill readings as low as 30
below zero.

* WHERE...Daniels, Sheridan, and Western Roosevelt Counties.

* WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 8 PM MST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions and reduced
visibilities. The cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero
could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30
minutes.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 8 PM MST MONDAY
